contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to people who do nothing all day but drink alcoholic drinks. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: those who rise up early in the morning ... who linger late into the night

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh uses the word "depths" and "height" to mean Ahaz could ask him for anything. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: ask for it in the depths or in the height above

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) this emphasizes that God will completely destroy the forests and farmlands. Alternate translation: "completely" or 2) this means God will completely destroy the people of Assyria. The phrase "soul and body" refers to the spiritual part and the physical part of a person. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: both soul and body

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "far" and "near" are used together to mean "everywhere." Alternate translation: "a people who are feared everywhere" or "a people that everyone in the earth fears" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: a people feared far and near

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "far" and "near" are used together to mean "everywhere." Alternate translation: "a people who are feared everywhere" or "a people that everyone in the earth fears" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: a people feared far and near

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "night" and "day" are combined here to mean "all the time." Alternate translation: "all the time" or "continually" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: night and day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means "throughout the entire day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: by day and night

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh uses the words "far away" and "near" to mean all people. The word "might" can be expressed with the adjective "mighty." Alternate translation: "All people everywhere hear what I have done and acknowledge that I am mighty" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: You who are far away, hear what I have done; and, you who are near, acknowledge my might

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means all of the time. Alternate translation: "It will burn throughout the night and the day" or "It will burn constantly, all night and all day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: It will burn night and day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he created everything. Alternate translation: "You made everything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: You made the heavens and the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to all activities of life. Alternate translation: "I know everything you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: But I know your sitting down, your going out, your coming in

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "good" and "evil" form a merism and represent anything. Alternate translation: "do anything at all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: do something good or evil

contextId.occurrenceNote: The directions "east" and "west" form a merism and represent from every direction. Alternate translation: "I will bring you and your offspring from every direction" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: I will bring your offspring from the east, and gather you from the west

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase emphasizes Yahweh's eternal nature. Possible meanings are 1) "I am the one who began all things, and I am the one who ends all things" or 2) "I am the one who has always lived, and I am the one who always will live." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: I am the first, and I am the last

contextId.occurrenceNote: "you lowest parts of the earth." Possible meanings are 1) that this refers to very deep places on the earth such as caves or canyons and forms a merism with "heavens" in the previous phrase or 2) that this refers to the place of the dead. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: you depths of the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: Since the sun rises in the east, this phrase forms a merism and means everywhere on earth. Alternate translation: "from every place on earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: from the rising of the sun, and from the west

contextId.occurrenceNote: Both of these expressions form merisms that emphasize that Yahweh is sovereign creator of everything. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: I form the light and create darkness; I bring peace and create disaster

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase emphasizes Yahweh's eternal nature. Possible meanings are 1) "I am the one who began all things, and I am the one who ends all things" or 2) "I am the one who has always lived, and I am the one who always will live." See how you translated a similar phrase in [Isaiah 44:6](../44/06.md). (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: I am the first, I also am the last

contextId.occurrenceNote: Isaiah combines these words to mean people in all places of the world. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: from the west ... from the sun's rising

contextId.occurrenceNote: Both are extremes that also represent everything between. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: new heavens and a new earth
